dram-simplescalar.cpp

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 /* dram-simplescalar.cpp:
00002    Based on SimpleScalar memory model (constant latency DRAM):
00003    Given latency in cpu cycles, or in ns which
00004    we'll convert to cpu cycles for you.
00005    Per-chunk latency computed based on cpu-speed,
00006    fsb-speed, and whether fsb uses DDR.
00007 
00008    This isn't precisely the same as the traditional SimpleScalar
00009    mode, but it's pretty close.
00010 
00011    usage:
00012      -dram simplescalar:LAT:UNITS (UNITS: 0=cycles, 1=ns)
00013 
00014    examples:
00015      -dram simplescalar:160   (160 sim_cycle's per access)
00016      -dram simplescalar:160:0 (ditto)
00017      -dram simplescalar:120:1 (120 ns per access) */
00018 /*
00019  * __COPYRIGHT__ GT
00020  */
00021 
00022 
00023 #define COMPONENT_NAME "simplescalar"
00024 
00025 #ifdef DRAM_PARSE_ARGS
00026 if(!strcasecmp(COMPONENT_NAME,type))
00027 {
00028   int latency;
00029   int units = 0; /* 0=cycle, 1=ns */
00030            
00031   if(sscanf(opt_string,"%*[^:]:%d:%d",&latency,&units) != 2)
00032   {
00033     if(sscanf(opt_string,"%*[^:]:%d",&latency) != 1)
00034       fatal("bad dram options string %s (should be \"simplescalar:latency[:units]\")",opt_string);
00035   }
00036   return new dram_simplescalar_t(latency,units);
00037 }
00038 #else
00039 
00040 class dram_simplescalar_t:public dram_t
00041 {
00042   protected:
00043   int latency;
00044   int chunk_latency;
00045 
00046   public:
00047 
00048   /* CREATE */
00049   dram_simplescalar_t(int arg_latency,
00050                       int arg_units)
00051   {
00052     init();
00053 
00054     if(arg_units < 0 || arg_units > 1)
00055       fatal("simplescalar dram model's optional units arguments should be 0 (cycles) or 1 (ns)");
00056 
00057     if(arg_units)
00058       latency = (int)ceil(arg_latency * uncore->cpu_speed/1000.0);
00059     else
00060       latency = arg_latency;
00061 
00062     chunk_latency = uncore->cpu_ratio;
00063     best_latency = INT_MAX;
00064   }
00065 
00066   /* ACCESS */
00067   DRAM_ACCESS_HEADER
00068   {
00069     int chunks = (bsize + (uncore->fsb_width-1)) >> uncore->fsb_bits; /* burst length, rounded up */
00070     dram_assert(chunks > 0,latency);
00071     int lat = latency + ((chunk_latency * chunks)>>uncore->fsb_DDR);
00072 
00073     total_accesses++;
00074     total_latency += lat;
00075     total_burst += chunks;
00076     if(lat < best_latency)
00077       best_latency = lat;
00078     if(lat > worst_latency)
00079       worst_latency = lat;
00080 
00081     return lat;
00082   }
00083 };
00084 
00085 #endif /* DRAM_PARSE_ARGS */
00086 #undef COMPONENT_NAME
